intro: Calyptranthes baracoensis, commonly known as the Baracoa calyptranthe, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Cuba. It belongs to the family Calypthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures. Calyptranthes baracoensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
